biased_opinion.summary: Nova Eroica is Tuscan strade bianche—135 km, 2,800 m elevation. Founded ~2015. 70% gravel (strade bianche), 30% paved. Rolling Tuscan hills, iconic white roads. 1,000-1,500 riders. Buonconvento medieval town. October autumn conditions (12-22°C). Affordable entry (€80-€120 / $85-$130). If you want Italian gravel with Tuscan scenery and strade bianche, this is it. If you want local/domestic race, skip it. International destination race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Nova Eroica is Tuscan strade bianche paradise. 135 km, 2,800 m, iconic white roads. If you want Italian gravel with stunning Tuscan scenery and affordable entry, this is it. If you want local/domestic, skip it. International travel required but Tuscany makes it worth it. Post-race food/wine is legendary.

black_pill.title: INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL + 135KM + DUSTY STRADE BIANCHE
black_pill.reality: International travel to Italy required. Florence airport 80 km (1.5-hour drive). 135 km is long. 2,800 m cumulative elevation. October autumn = 30% rain risk. Dusty strade bianche (white roads). 10-15% DNF. You'll pay €80-€120 ($85-$130) + international travel. If you need local/domestic, this isn't it. If you want Tuscan strade bianche with medieval town charm, this is it. Affordable entry but travel adds up.
black_pill.expectation_reset: Nova Eroica is international destination race. Italy travel required. 135 km, 2,800 m cumulative. If you need local/domestic, skip it. If you want Tuscan strade bianche with stunning scenery and affordable entry, this is it. Travel adds cost but Tuscany experience is worth it.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Florence (FLR). Rental car needed (80 km, 1.5-hour drive to Buonconvento). Medieval town lodging—book early. Day-before packet pickup. Race October. Post-race Tuscan food/wine.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party with Tuscan food/wine celebration.
